Tuesday, June 26, 2007























Judge tosses $54 million suit over missing pants
A judge in the District of Columbia dismissed a case against a dry cleaner who was sued for $54 million in damages over a pair of missing pants.
FULL STORY


























NANCY GRACE Airs on Headline PRIME, 8 p.m. ET
"Nancy Grace" is television's only justice-themed interview and debate show. Nancy Grace challenges guests
on the most controversial and high-profile legal issues of the day by drawing on her unique perspective
as a former violent crimes prosecutor and as a crime victim herself.  Send your questions and comments.





















Was innocent man executed?
To the very end, convicted killer Larry Griffin shouted his innocence to the world -- through court filings, in pleas to the governor and to nearly any reporter willing to listen.
FULL STORY






Spector jury sees gory photos
Jurors in Phil Spector's murder trial are bombarded with photos of actress Lana Clarkson's face, some showing blood oozing from her mouth.
FULL STORY






Mob not like 'Sopranos,' jury told
Chicago's biggest mob trial in years started with a prosecutor urging the jury to forget what they know about movie mobsters and see the defendants for who they are.
FULL STORY






Tax dodgers taunt police
To avoid serving prison sentences for tax-evasion convictions, Ed Brown and his wife, Elaine, have locked themselves off from the world on their own terms.
FULL STORY
